|coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_type = region:US_type:city |latd = 39|latm = 1 |lats = 48|latNS = N |longd = 81|longm = 24|longs = 24|longEW = W <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]]s |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Palestine''' is an [[unincorporated community]] in [[Wirt County, West Virginia|Wirt County]], [[West Virginia]], in the [[United States]]. It is located at the confluence of the [[Little Kanawha River]] and [[Reedy Creek (West Virginia)|Reedy Creek]],<ref>{{cite book| title= West Virginia Atlas & Gazetteer |year=1997 |publisher= [[DeLorme]] |location=Yarmouth, Me. |isbn= 0-89933-246-3 |page= 33}}</ref> at {{coord|39|01|48|N|81|24|24|W|region:US_type:city}}, at an elevation of 682 feet (208 m).<ref>{{cite web |url={{Gnis3|1544536}} |title=Geographic Names Information System entry for Palestine (Feature ID #1544536) |author=Geographic Names Information System |authorlink=Geographic Names Information System|accessdate=2007-05-06}}</ref> Its [[ZIP code]] is 26160.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.zipinfo.com/cgi-local/zipsrch.exe?cnty=cnty&zip=26160 |title= ZIP Code Lookup | accessdate=2007-05-06}}</ref> The community was named for [[Palestine]].<ref name=Kenny>{{cite book| author=Kenny, Hamill |title= West Virginia Place Names: Their Origin and Meaning, Including the Nomenclature of the Streams and Mountains |year=1945 |publisher=The Place Name Press |location=Piedmont, West Virginia |pages= 470–471}}</ref> Prior to 1905, the name of Palestine's post office was '''Reedy Ripple''', to distinguish its name from a community named "Palatine" in [[Marion County, West Virginia|Marion County]]; the name "Reedy Ripple" derived from an accumulation of gravel in the Little Kanawha River at the mouth of Reedy Creek.<ref name=Kenny/> Palestine gained notice in 2003 for being the hometown of [[Jessica Lynch]]. The [[Buffalo Church]] near Palestine was listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] in 1990.<ref name="nris">{{NRISref|2009a}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Wirt County, West Virginia}} [[Category:Unincorporated communities in West Virginia]] [[Category:Populated places in Wirt County, West Virginia]] [[Category:Little Kanawha River]] [[Category:Parkersburg–Marietta–Vienna metropolitan area]] {{WirtWV-geo-stub}}
